metadata.description:
The data set contains meteorological observation data of zhangye wetland station in the middle reaches of heihe hydrometeorological observation network from January 1, 2015 to December 31, 2015.The site is located in zhangye national wetland park in gansu province.The latitude and longitude of the observation point is 100.4464E, 38.9751N, and altitude is 1460m.Air temperature and relative humidity sensors are set up at 5m and 10m, facing due north.The barometer is installed at 2m;The inverted bucket rain gauge is installed at 10m;The wind speed sensor is set up at 5m and 10m, and the wind direction sensor is set up at 10m, facing due north.The four-component radiometer is installed at 6m, facing due south;The two infrared thermometers are installed at the position of 6m, facing south, and the probe is facing vertically downward.The soil temperature probe is buried at 0cm on the surface and 2cm, 4cm, 10cm, 20cm and 40cm underground, in the south due to 2m from the meteorological tower.The soil hot flow plates (3) are successively buried in the ground 6cm;Four photosynthetic radiometers are installed above and inside the canopy respectively. The upper part of the canopy is installed at 6m (one probe vertically up and one probe vertically down), and the upper part of the canopy is installed at 0.25m (one probe vertically up and one probe vertically down), facing due south.
Observation items are: air temperature and humidity (Ta_5m RH_5m Ta_10m, RH_10m) (unit: c, percentage), pressure (Press) (unit: hundred mpa), precipitation (Rain) (unit: mm), wind speed (WS_5m, WS_10m) (unit: m/s), wind (WD_10m) (unit: degrees), the radiation of four component (DR, UR, DLR_Cor, ULR_Cor, Rn) (unit: watts per square meter), the surface radiation temperature (IRT_1, IRT_2) (unit:Degrees Celsius), soil heat flux (Gs_1, Gs_2, Gs_3) (unit: watts per square meter), soil temperature (Ts_0cm Ts_2cm Ts_4cm, Ts_10cm, Ts_20cm, Ts_40cm) (unit: c), the canopy on the up and down photosynthetic active radiation (PAR_U_up, PAR_U_down) (unit: second micromoles/m2) and up and down under canopy photosynthetic active radiation (PAR_D_up, PAR_D_down) (unit: second micromoles/m2).
Processing and quality control of observation data :(1) ensure 144 data per day (every 10min). If data is missing, it will be marked by -6999;(2) eliminate the moments with duplicate records;(3) data that is obviously beyond the physical meaning or the range of the instrument is deleted;(4) the part marked by red letter in the data is the data in question;(5) the format of date and time is uniform, and the date and time are in the same column.For example, the time is: 2015-6-10-10:30;(6) the naming rule is: AWS+ site name.
Please refer to Li et al. (2013) for hydrometeorological network or site information, and Liu et al. (2011) for observation data processing.

该数据集包含了2015年1月1日至2015年12月31日黑河水文气象观测网中游张掖湿地站气象要素观测数据。站点位于甘肃省张掖市国家湿地公园，下垫面是芦苇湿地。观测点的经纬度是100.4464E, 38.9751N，海拔1460m。空气温度、相对湿度传感器架设在5m、10m处，朝向正北；气压计安装在2m处；翻斗式雨量计安装在10m处；风速传感器架设在5m、10m处，风向传感器架设在10m处，朝向正北；四分量辐射仪安装在6m处，朝向正南；两个红外温度计安装在6m处，朝向正南，探头朝向是垂直向下；土壤温度探头埋设在地表0cm和地下2cm、4cm、10cm、20cm、40cm处，在距离气象塔2m的正南方；土壤热流板（3块）依次埋设在地下6cm处；四个光合有效辐射仪分别架设在冠层上方和冠层内，冠层上方安装在6m（探头垂直向上和向下方向各一个）、冠层内安装在0.25m（探头垂直向上和向下方向各一个）高处，朝向正南。
观测项目有：空气温湿度（Ta_5m、RH_5m、Ta_10m、RH_10m）(单位：摄氏度、百分比)、气压（Press）(单位：百帕)、降水量（Rain）(单位：毫米)、风速（WS_5m、WS_10m）(单位：米/秒)、风向（WD_10m）(单位：度)、四分量辐射（DR、UR、DLR_Cor、ULR_Cor、Rn）(单位：瓦/平方米)、地表辐射温度（IRT_1、IRT_2）(单位：摄氏度)、土壤热通量（Gs_1、Gs_2、Gs_3）(单位：瓦/平方米)、土壤温度（Ts_0cm、Ts_2cm、Ts_4cm、Ts_10cm、Ts_20cm、Ts_40cm）(单位：摄氏度)、冠层上向上与向下光合有效辐射（PAR_U_up、PAR_U_down）(单位：微摩尔/平方米秒)和冠层下向上与向下光合有效辐射（PAR_D_up、PAR_D_down）(单位：微摩尔/平方米秒)。
观测数据的处理与质量控制：（1）确保每天144个数据（每10min），若出现数据的缺失，则由-6999标示；（2）剔除有重复记录的时刻；（3）删除了明显超出物理意义或超出仪器量程的数据；（4）数据中以红字标示的部分为有疑问的数据；（5）日期和时间的格式统一，并且日期、时间在同一列。如，时间为：2015-6-10 10:30；（6）命名规则为：AWS+站点名称。
水文气象网或站点信息请参考Li et al. (2013)，观测数据处理请参考Liu et al. (2011)。

background: The two-source energy balance (TSEB) model was successfully applied to estimate evaporation (E), transpiration (T), and evapotranspiration (ET) for land covered with vegetation, which has significantly important applications for the terrestrial water cycle and water resource management. One-source evapotranspiration estimation models combine the soil–vegetation components into a single source. However, in real landscape conditions, the surface is heterogeneous and contains a mixture of soil and vegetation having different temperatures and resistance to energy exchange. Therefore, one-source models explicitly cannot estimate the surface evapotranspiration accurately because the effect of.

Shuttleworth and Wallace proposed a typical two-source evapotranspiration estimation model in which the energy partition is assumed to occur in both “the above canopy” and “the under soil” cases. Water vapor and heat meet over the reference height in the interior of the canopy. Moreover, the mixed water vapor and heat can only exit through the top of the canopy; the total heat flux is in addition to the fluxes coming from every surface layer. However, the model is complex, having over five resistances that cannot be accurately calculated. In addition, the model includes required parameters and observations that cannot be readily obtained from operational satellite- and ground-based data; therefore, the range of applications of the model is limited.

The TSEB model has undergone several revisions, improving the estimation of soil and canopy net radiation, the aerodynamic resistance of the soil surface, the fractional vegetation coverage observed at the radiometer view angle, the distribution of regional-scale near-surface air temperature, and soil and canopy component temperatures. Because the TSEB model only requires the surface energy balance model with a single measurement of land surface temperature, the original model and subsequent refinements have been widely used to estimate E and T under a wide variety of vegetation types, vegetation coverage, climates, and spatial scales. However, most studies have only evaluated the total fluxes or ET (soil plus canopy) in comparison with measurements using the Bowen ratio–energy balance system, the eddy covariance (EC) system, or the large aperture scintillometer.

Accurately estimating surface fluxes in a strongly advective irrigated agricultural area is a particularly challenging task and is even more difficult when the EC flux measurements of H and LE have an incomplete energy balance closure with respect to the available energy Rn−G0. The previous sensitivity studies found that the TSEB model performance is mainly affected by the uncertainty in surface–air temperature difference. Sometimes, this difference is dominant due to the errors in determining the surface soil and vegetation component temperatures from the surface composite radiometric temperature. In this letter, it is shown that there is an overestimation of the component temperatures compared with the observed composite radiometric. This often leads to the most crucial effect on the TSEB model performance. In addition, another factor is the strong advective environment in this region.
research objective: In this letter, the ground-measured soil and canopy component temperatures were used to estimate E, T, and ET, which were better validated with observed ratios of E (E/ET%) and T (T/ET%) using the stable oxygen and hydrogen isotopes, and the ET measurements using an eddy covariance (EC) system.

The objective of this letter is to estimate E, T, and ET using the soil and canopy component temperatures observed via a high-resolution thermal camera as inputs to a series TSEB model and to subsequently better validate E, T, and ET using a combination of the stable oxygen and hydrogen isotope technique and EC measurements.
challenges: However, the current composite temperature separation approaches are limited in their effectiveness in arid regions. Moreover, E and T are difficult to measure on the ground.

Errors in the derived component temperature were primarily caused by image classification errors; these classification errors varied with vegetation abundance. The higher uncertainty of H estimation is not only caused by the uncertainty of the TSEB model but also due to the increased uncertainty of the EC system, which is 18% when the mean H is small in the irrigated farmland. Due to image pixel classification errors, soil pixels were counted as vegetation pixels, which produced an overestimation of the canopy temperature under the developing vegetation abundance. Alternatively, ignoring atmospheric upwelling radiation and transmittance could have produced the uncertainties in the estimated temperatures. In addition, the estimated uncertainty of the incoming short- and long-wave radiation transmittances through the canopy may be another source of Rn estimation errors.
methods: In this letter, the field observations were obtained from the Daman superstation installed in the central oasis, which is a 40-m boundary layer tower located at 100.3722° E, 38.8555° N and at an elevation of 1556 m. The meteorological parameters were measured every 10 min and included air temperature, wind speed, humidity at 5 m over the ground, four-component radiations (measured at 12 m above the ground using a four-component radiometer), and turbulent fluxes (measured at 4.5 m above the ground using an EC system with a sampling frequency of 10 Hz). The soil heat fluxes were measured using three heat plates located 6 cm under the ground. A Fluke Ti55 thermal infrared camera was manually operated on a 25-m-high platform on a boundary layer tower to measure the thermal radiation of the cropland approximately every 120 min; the observations were collected as thermal images from approximately 07:00 to 19:00 China Standard Time (CST) during the daytime. The ground-based measurement data were applied to partition ET into E and T applying the Craig–Gordon model.

To evaluate the TSEB model accurately, the soil heat flux was using the ground measurement. In addition, the soil and canopy sensible heat fluxes were estimated using the series TSEB model, and their latent heat fluxes were calculated while solving the energy balance equations (1) and (2), respectively. The soil and canopy component temperatures were calculated using the images obtained with the thermal camera. To calculate the component temperatures, the visible and NIR images were classified into soil and canopy pixels using the maximum-likelihood method. Next, the soil and canopy directional brightness temperatures were exacted from the thermal images. Finally, the thermal infrared temperatures were converted to the radiation temperatures using the incoming long-wave radiation from the sky and the soil and canopy emissivities. Next, the simulated radiometric temperatures were validated against the surface radiometric temperatures, which were calculated according to the incoming long-wave radiation observed by the four-component radiometer.
dataset: The experimental area is an artificial oasis that is covered with maize, vegetables, and orchards. Data of day of year (DOY) 170, 173, 176, 192, 195, 231, 252, and 256 were used to determine ET and the ratios of E (E/ET%) and T (T/ET%) to ET during the Multi-Scale Observation Experiment on Evapotranspiration over heterogeneous land surfaces, which was part of the Heihe Water Allied Telemetry Experimental Research (HiWATER-MUSOEXE).
findings: Our results indicated that even under the strongly advective conditions, the TSEB model produced reliable estimates of the E/ET% and T/ET% ratios and of ET. The mean bias and root-mean-square error (RMSE) of E/ET% were 1% and 2%, respectively, and the mean bias and RMSE of T/ET% were −1% and 2%, respectively. In addition, the model exhibited relatively reliable estimates in the latent heat flux, with mean bias and RMSE values of 31 and 61 W·m−2, respectively, compared with the measurements from the EC system. These results demonstrated that a robust soil and vegetation component temperature calculation was crucial for estimating E, T, and ET. Moreover, the separate validation of E/ET% and T/ET% provides a good prospect for TSEB model improvements.

Our results demonstrated that the TSEB model using soil and canopy component radiometric temperatures, which were obtained from a high-precision thermal infrared camera, can be applied in a strongly advection-irrigated agricultural area. Notably, the results illustrated that the latent fluxes of the soil and vegetation components were successfully separated with reasonable accuracy, as assessed using ground-based measurements. The estimated E/ET% and E/ET% values agreed well with the values observed using the stable oxygen and hydrogen isotopes technique during the early, middle, and late growing seasons. In addition, the TSEB model produced reliable estimations of Rn, H, and LE; the mean biases of Rn, H, and LE were −18, 5, and 31 W ·m−2, respectively, and the RMSEs of Rn, H, and LE were 29, 19, and 61 W · m−2, respectively. This finding suggests that given accurate soil and vegetation component temperatures, E and T can be accurately separated from ET using the TSEB model.
backgroundCn: 双源能量平衡（TSEB）模型成功应用于估算植被覆盖土地的蒸发（E）、蒸腾（T）和蒸散发（ET），这对陆地水循环和水资源管理具有重要意义。单源蒸散发估算模型将土壤-植被组件合并为一个单一源。然而，在真实的景观条件下，表面是异质的，包含具有不同温度和能量交换阻力的土壤和植被的混合物。因此，单源模型显然无法准确估算表面蒸散发，因为其影响。

Shuttleworth和Wallace提出了一种典型的双源蒸散发估算模型，该模型假设能量分配发生在“冠层上方”和“土壤下方”两种情况。水蒸气和热量在冠层内部的参考高度相遇。此外，混合的水蒸气和热量只能通过冠层顶部排出；总热通量是除了来自每个表层的通量之外的额外通量。然而，该模型较为复杂，具有超过五个无法准确计算的阻力。此外，该模型还包括一些所需的参数和观测数据，这些数据无法从操作性卫星和地面数据中轻易获得；因此，该模型的应用范围受到限制。

TSEB模型经过多次修订，改善了土壤和冠层净辐射的估算、土壤表面的气动阻力、在辐射仪视角下观察到的植被覆盖度、区域尺度近地面气温的分布以及土壤和冠层组分的温度。由于TSEB模型只需要一个地表温度的单一测量值来进行表面能量平衡模型的计算，因此原始模型及其后续改进已被广泛用于在各种植被类型、植被覆盖、气候和空间尺度下估算蒸散发（E）和温度（T）。然而，大多数研究仅评估了总通量或蒸散发（土壤加冠层）与使用波恩比-能量平衡系统、涡度协方差（EC）系统或大孔径闪烁仪的测量结果的比较。

在强烈的平流灌溉农业区域，准确估计表面通量是一项特别具有挑战性的任务，当EC通量测量的H和LE与可用能量Rn−G0之间存在能量平衡闭合不完全时，这一任务变得更加困难。之前的敏感性研究发现，TSEB模型的性能主要受到表面-空气温差不确定性的影响。有时，这种温差由于从表面复合辐射温度中确定表面土壤和植被组分温度的误差而占主导地位。本文显示，与观测到的复合辐射温度相比，组分温度存在过高估计。这通常对TSEB模型的性能产生最关键的影响。此外，该区域的强平流环境也是另一个因素。
research objectiveCn: 在这封信中，地面测量的土壤和冠层成分温度被用来估算蒸散（E）、蒸发（T）和蒸散发（ET），这些估算通过稳定的氧和氢同位素以及使用涡度协方差（EC）系统的ET测量结果进行了更好的验证，得到了E（E/ET%）和T（T/ET%）的观察比率。
这封信的目的是利用通过高分辨率热像仪观察到的土壤和冠层组件温度作为输入，估算蒸散发（E）、温度（T）和蒸散发总量（ET），并随后通过稳定氧和氢同位素技术与涡度相关（EC）测量的结合，更好地验证E、T和ET。
challengesCn: 然而，目前的复合温度分离方法在干旱地区的有效性有限。此外，E和T在地面上难以测量。

导出组件温度的误差主要是由于图像分类错误引起的，这些分类错误随着植被丰度的变化而变化。H估计的不确定性不仅是由于TSEB模型的不确定性，还由于EC系统的不确定性，当灌溉农田的平均H较小时，这种不确定性为18%。由于图像像素分类错误，土壤像素被错误地计为植被像素，这导致在植被丰度发展的情况下，冠层温度的过高估计。另一方面，忽略大气上行辐射和透射率可能导致估计温度的不确定性。此外，估计的通过冠层的短波和长波辐射透射率的不确定性可能是Rn估计误差的另一个来源。
methodsCn: 在这封信中，现场观测数据来自于安装在中央绿洲的达曼超级站，该站是一座40米高的边界层塔，位于东经100.3722°，北纬38.8555°，海拔1556米。气象参数每10分钟测量一次，包括地面5米处的气温、风速和湿度，12米高处使用四分量辐射计测量的四分量辐射，以及使用10 Hz采样频率的涡度相关系统在4.5米高处测量的湍流通量。土壤热通量通过位于地下6厘米的三个热板进行测量。一台Fluke Ti55热红外相机在边界层塔的25米高平台上手动操作，约每120分钟测量一次农田的热辐射；观测数据在中国标准时间（CST）白天的07:00至19:00期间收集为热图像。基于地面测量数据，应用Craig–Gordon模型将蒸散发（ET）分解为蒸发（E）和蒸腾（T）。

为了准确评估TSEB模型，土壤热通量使用地面测量数据。此外，土壤和冠层的显热通量是通过系列TSEB模型估算的，而它们的潜热通量则通过求解能量平衡方程（1）和（2）来计算。土壤和冠层的组件温度是使用热像仪获得的图像计算的。为了计算组件温度，使用最大似然法将可见光和近红外图像分类为土壤和冠层像素。接下来，从热成像图像中提取土壤和冠层的方向亮度温度。最后，利用来自天空的入射长波辐射和土壤及冠层的发射率，将热红外温度转换为辐射温度。接着，模拟的辐射温度与根据四分量辐射计观测的入射长波辐射计算的表面辐射温度进行了验证。
datasetCn: 实验区域是一个人工绿洲，种植有玉米、蔬菜和果园。使用了第170、173、176、192、195、231、252和256天的数据来确定蒸散发（ET）及其在多尺度蒸散发观测实验（Multi-Scale Observation Experiment on Evapotranspiration over heterogeneous land surfaces）中的蒸发（E/ET%）和蒸腾（T/ET%）的比率，这项实验是黑河水联合遥测实验研究（Heihe Water Allied Telemetry Experimental Research，HiWATER-MUSOEXE）的一部分。
findingsCn: 我们的结果表明，即使在强烈的对流条件下，TSEB模型仍然能够可靠地估计E/ET%和T/ET%比率以及ET。E/ET%的平均偏差和均方根误差（RMSE）分别为1%和2%；而T/ET%的平均偏差和RMSE分别为−1%和2%。此外，该模型在潜热通量的估计上也表现出相对可靠的结果，与EC系统的测量值相比，平均偏差和RMSE值分别为31和61 W·m−2。这些结果表明，稳健的土壤和植被组件温度计算对于估计E、T和ET至关重要。此外，E/ET%和T/ET%的单独验证为TSEB模型的改进提供了良好的前景。

我们的结果表明，使用高精度热红外相机获得的土壤和冠层组件辐射温度的TSEB模型可以应用于强烈的平流灌溉农业区域。值得注意的是，结果表明土壤和植被组件的潜在通量成功地以合理的精度分离，经过地面测量的评估。估计的E/ET%和E/ET%值与在早期、中期和晚期生长季节使用稳定氧和氢同位素技术观察到的值一致。此外，TSEB模型对Rn、H和LE的估计也很可靠；Rn、H和LE的平均偏差分别为−18、5和31 W·m−2，Rn、H和LE的均方根误差（RMSE）分别为29、19和61 W·m−2。这一发现表明，给定准确的土壤和植被组件温度，E和T可以通过TSEB模型准确地从ET中分离出来。

background: Upscaling of eco-hydrological processes on a heterogeneous surface is a grand challenge. Progress in this field is hindered by the poor availability of multiscale observations. HiWATER is an experiment designed to address this challenge through instrumentation on hierarchically nested scales to obtain multiscale and multidisciplinary data.
challenges: Progress in this field is hindered by the poor availability of multiscale observations.
methods: Several intensive observation periods (IOPs) and continuous hydrometeorological observations were carried out during HiWATER. Only data collected during the IOP in 2012 are presented in this paper. Instruments for the oasis-desert system were arranged in hierarchically nested scales to capture multi-scale eco-hydrological processes. We established a sparse network to investigate the oasis-desert interaction. One superstation was constructed within the oasis, and four EC towers and four two-layer automatic meteorological stations (AMSs) were installed in different landscapes surrounding the oasis, including sandy desert, desert pavement, desert steppe, and wetland. Intensive observations were implemented at the irrigation district scale. A total of 12 airborne remote sensing missions were conducted to cover the FEA using LiDAR, an imaging spectrometer, a multi-angle thermal imager, and an L-band microwave radiometer.
dataset: We introduce a multiscale dataset obtained from Heihe Watershed Allied Telemetry Experimental Research (HiWATER) in an oasis-desert area in 2012. The HiWATER observation system consists of a flux observation matrix of eddy covariance towers, large aperture scintillometers, and automatic meteorological stations; an eco-hydrological sensor network of soil moisture and leaf area index; hyper-resolution airborne remote sensing using LiDAR, imaging spectrometer, multi-angle thermal imager, and L-band microwave radiometer; and synchronical ground measurements of vegetation dynamics and photosynthesis processes. All observational data were carefully quality controlled throughout sensor calibration, data collection, data processing, and datasets generation. The data are freely available at figshare and the Cold and Arid Regions Science Data Centre.
backgroundCn: 生态水文过程在异质表面上的上升尺度是一个重大挑战。该领域的进展受到多尺度观测数据稀缺的制约。HiWATER实验旨在通过在分层嵌套尺度上进行仪器布置，以获取多尺度和多学科的数据，从而应对这一挑战。
challengesCn: 该领域的进展受到多尺度观测稀缺的阻碍。
methodsCn: 在HiWATER期间进行了几次强烈观测期（IOPs）和连续的水文气象观测。本文仅呈现2012年IOP期间收集的数据。为了捕捉多尺度生态水文过程，绿洲-沙漠系统的仪器按照层次嵌套的尺度进行布置。我们建立了一个稀疏网络，以研究绿洲-沙漠的相互作用。在绿洲内建造了一个超级站，并在绿洲周围不同的景观中安装了四个涡度（EC）塔和四个双层自动气象站（AMS），这些景观包括沙质沙漠、沙漠铺装、沙漠草原和湿地。在灌溉区尺度上实施了强烈观测。共进行了12次空中遥感任务，使用了激光雷达、成像光谱仪、多角度热成像仪和L波段微波辐射计，覆盖了FEA区域。
datasetCn: 我们介绍了一个多尺度数据集，该数据集来自2012年在绿洲-沙漠地区进行的黑河流域联合遥测实验研究（HiWATER）。HiWATER观测系统由涡度协方差塔、大孔径闪烁仪和自动气象站组成的通量观测矩阵；土壤湿度和叶面积指数的生态水文传感器网络；使用激光雷达、成像光谱仪、多角度热成像仪和L波段微波辐射计的超高分辨率航空遥感；以及同步的植被动态和光合作用过程的地面测量。所有观测数据在传感器校准、数据收集、数据处理和数据集生成过程中都经过了严格的质量控制。这些数据可在figshare和寒区与干旱区科学数据中心免费获取。

background: Arid and semiarid regions represent approximately 30 % of the global terrestrial surface area (Dregne, 1991; Scanlon et al., 2006), and dryland expansion occurs under climate change, especially in developing countries (Huang et al., 2016). An oasis is a unique ecological landscape in arid and semi-arid areas that is not only the core of regions’ ecological environment but also the foundation of their economic development, especially in western China, which has been an important part of the “Silk Road” since ancient times. Oases comprising less than 10 % of the total area of arid regions support more than 90 % of the population in these regions of China (Chu et al., 2005; Li et al., 2016; Zhou et al., 2022). The oasis–desert system plays a crucial role in maintaining a stable ecological environment and agricultural productivity (Zhang and Zhao, 2015). Extensive studies have investigated energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert areas based on field and remote-sensing observations (Taha et al., 1991; Potchter et al., 2008; Xue et al., 2019; Wang et al., 2019; Zhou et al., 2022) and numerical simulations (Chu et al., 2005; Meng et al., 2009; Georgescu et al., 2011; Liu et al., 2020). In addition, oasis–desert areas located in semiarid regions have been found to be carbon sinks by previous researchers (Tagesson et al., 2016; Wang et al., 2019); thus, they can significantly affect the carbon balance of arid regions and play an increasingly important role within the global carbon cycle.
research objective: Therefore, it is critical to maintain the balance between oasis and desert systems in order to achieve the goal of sustainable oasis development. Understanding the basic characteristics of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert ecosystems is important to achieve the goals of carbon peaking and carbon neutrality in the oasis–desert area and support the ecological security and sustainable development of the oasis. A quantitative understanding of the energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert areas is crucial to recognize the oasis–desert interactions and is significant to protect the ecological stability and socioeconomic development of oases; moreover, long-term observations are indispensable.
challenges: Inland river basins in arid and semiarid areas are facing the crisis of ecological environment degradation, such as the drying up of rivers and lakes, the degradation of natural vegetation, the intensification of land desertification, and the frequent occurrence of dust storms, especially in many inland river basins westward along the Silk Road, such as the Tarim River basin (Zhao et al., 2013), the Aral Sea basin (Stanev et al., 2004; Crétaux et al., 2009), and the Lake Urmia basin (Stone, 2015).
methods: In this study, we present a suite of observational datasets from artificial and natural oasis–desert systems that consist of long-term energy, water vapor, carbon and methane fluxes as well as auxiliary data involving hydrometeorology, vegetation, and soil parameters from 2012 to 2021. Half-hourly turbulent flux data were acquired by an eddy covariance system and scintillometer. The hydrometeorological data (including radiation, soil heat flux, and soil temperature profiles; gradients of air temperature and humidity and of wind speed and direction; and air pressure, precipitation, and soil moisture profiles) were observed from automatic weather stations with a 10 min average period as well as the groundwater table data. Moreover, vegetation and soil parameters were also supplemented in the datasets. The data processing and quality control procedure can be divided into data collection, data processing, and data archiving and sharing.
dataset: The study area comprises the middle and lower reaches of the HRB, located in the arid regions of western China, that receive water from the typical cryosphere of the upper reaches. A total of 11 land surface flux and meteorological stations have been established in these regions since 2012 – 2 superstations and 9 ordinary stations. The dataset of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange observations in oasis–desert areas reported in this study (including energy, water vapor, and carbon fluxes; hydrometeorological data; and vegetation and soil parameters) is freely available from the National Tibetan Plateau Data Center.
backgroundCn: 干旱和半干旱地区大约占全球陆地表面积的30%（Dregne, 1991；Scanlon et al., 2006），在气候变化的影响下，干旱地区的扩展尤其发生在发展中国家（Huang et al., 2016）。绿洲是干旱和半干旱地区独特的生态景观，不仅是这些地区生态环境的核心，也是其经济发展的基础，特别是在中国西部，自古以来就一直是“丝绸之路”的重要组成部分。绿洲占干旱地区总面积的不到10%，却支持着中国这些地区90%以上的人口（Chu et al., 2005；Li et al., 2016；Zhou et al., 2022）。绿洲-沙漠系统在维持稳定的生态环境和农业生产力方面发挥着至关重要的作用（Zhang and Zhao, 2015）。大量研究基于实地和遥感观测（Taha et al., 1991；Potchter et al., 2008；Xue et al., 2019；Wang et al., 2019；Zhou et al., 2022）以及数值模拟（Chu et al., 2005；Meng et al., 2009；Georgescu et al., 2011；Liu et al., 2020）对绿洲-沙漠地区的能量、水汽和碳交换进行了广泛研究。此外，位于半干旱地区的绿洲-沙漠区域被前期研究者发现是碳汇（Tagesson et al., 2016；Wang et al., 2019）；因此，它们可以显著影响干旱地区的碳平衡，并在全球碳循环中发挥越来越重要的作用。
research objectiveCn: 因此，维持绿洲与沙漠系统之间的平衡对于实现可持续绿洲发展的目标至关重要。了解绿洲-沙漠生态系统中能量、水汽和碳交换的基本特征，对于实现绿洲-沙漠地区的碳达峰和碳中和目标，以及支持绿洲的生态安全和可持续发展具有重要意义。对绿洲-沙漠地区能量、水汽和碳交换的定量理解对于认识绿洲-沙漠之间的相互作用至关重要，并且对保护绿洲的生态稳定性和社会经济发展具有重要意义；此外，长期观测是不可或缺的。
challengesCn: 内陆河流流域在干旱和半干旱地区面临生态环境退化的危机，例如河流和湖泊干涸、自然植被退化、土地沙漠化加剧以及沙尘暴频繁发生，尤其是在丝绸之路沿线的许多内陆河流流域，如塔里木河流域（赵等，2013），阿拉尔海流域（Stanev等，2004；Crétaux等，2009）和乌尔米湖流域（Stone，2015）。
methodsCn: 在本研究中，我们呈现了一套来自人工和自然绿洲–沙漠系统的观测数据集，包括2012年至2021年的长期能量、水蒸气、碳和甲烷通量，以及涉及水文气象、植被和土壤参数的辅助数据。半小时的湍流通量数据通过涡度协方差系统和闪烁仪获取。水文气象数据（包括辐射、土壤热通量和土壤温度剖面；空气温度和湿度的梯度，风速和风向的梯度；空气压力、降水和土壤湿度剖面）通过自动气象站以10分钟的平均周期观测，同时还观察了地下水位数据。此外，数据集中还补充了植被和土壤参数。数据处理和质量控制程序可分为数据收集、数据处理和数据归档与共享。
datasetCn: 研究区域包括位于中国西部干旱地区的HRB中下游，水源来自上游典型的冰冻圈。自2012年以来，在这些地区建立了11个地表通量和气象站，包括2个超级站和9个普通站。本研究报告的绿洲-沙漠地区能量、水汽和碳交换观测数据集（包括能量、水汽和碳通量；水文气象数据；以及植被和土壤参数）可从国家西藏高原数据中心免费获取。

Disjunctive.QuestionCn: 与绿洲-沙漠系统中的能量、水汽和碳交换相关的数据集主要来源于涡度协方差系统、闪烁仪或自动气象站吗？

Concept Completion.AnswerCn: 国家青藏高原数据中心

Example.QuestionEn: Can you provide an example of a data collection method used to measure soil and canopy component temperatures in eco-hydrological research?
Example.QuestionCn: 您能否提供一个用于测量生态水文研究中土壤和树冠组成温度的数据收集方法的例子？
Example.AnswerEn: A data collection method involves using a Fluke Ti55 thermal infrared camera manually operated on a 25-m-high platform to measure thermal radiation of cropland. Thermal images are collected approximately every 120 minutes from 07:00 to 19:00 China Standard Time during the daytime.
Example.AnswerCn: 一种数据收集方法涉及使用Fluke Ti55热红外相机，在25米高的平台上手动操作，以测量农田的热辐射。热成像图像在中国标准时间的白天07:00至19:00之间每120分钟收集一次。

Example.QuestionEn: What is an example of a challenge faced in collecting multiscale observational data for eco-hydrological processes?
Example.QuestionCn: 收集生态水文过程的多尺度观测数据时面临的一个挑战是什么？
Example.AnswerEn: A challenge in collecting multiscale observational data is the poor availability of such observations, which hinders progress in upscaling eco-hydrological processes on heterogeneous surfaces.
Example.AnswerCn: 收集多尺度观测数据的一个挑战是此类观测的可用性较差，这阻碍了在异质表面上对生态水文过程进行上尺度处理的进展。

Example.QuestionEn: Can you provide an example of a dataset that includes multiscale and multidisciplinary observations in an oasis-desert area?
Example.QuestionCn: 您能否提供一个包含绿洲-沙漠地区多尺度和多学科观测的示例数据集？
Example.AnswerEn: An example of a dataset includes data obtained from the Heihe Watershed Allied Telemetry Experimental Research (HiWATER) in an oasis-desert area, which consists of a flux observation matrix of eddy covariance towers, large aperture scintillometers, automatic meteorological stations, an eco-hydrological sensor network, and hyper-resolution airborne remote sensing data.
Example.AnswerCn: 一个数据集的例子包括从黑河流域联合遥测实验研究（HiWATER）获得的数据，该区域是一个绿洲-沙漠地区，包含涡度协方差塔、大孔径闪烁仪、自动气象站、生态水文传感器网络和超高分辨率航空遥感数据的通量观测矩阵。

Feature Specification.QuestionEn: What are the key characteristics of a meteorological observation network in wetland areas for hydrometeorological studies?
Feature Specification.QuestionCn: 湿地地区用于水文气象研究的气象观测网络的关键特征是什么？
Feature Specification.AnswerEn: automatic stations, air temperature, relative humidity at different heights, atmospheric pressure, precipitation, wind speed and direction, radiation components, surface radiation temperature, soil heat flux, soil temperature at various depths, sensors placed above and below the canopy
Feature Specification.AnswerCn: 自动气象站、不同高度的空气温度、相对湿度、大气压力、降水、风速和风向、辐射分量、地表辐射温度、土壤热通量、不同深度的土壤温度、传感器放置在冠层上方和下方。

Feature Specification.QuestionEn: What attributes are essential for evaluating evapotranspiration models in heterogeneous landscapes?
Feature Specification.QuestionCn: 评估异质景观中的蒸散发模型所需的基本属性有哪些？
Feature Specification.AnswerEn: soil and canopy component temperatures, aerodynamic resistance, fractional vegetation coverage, regional-scale near-surface air temperature
Feature Specification.AnswerCn: 土壤和冠层组分温度、空气动力学阻力、植被覆盖率、区域尺度近地表空气温度

Feature Specification.QuestionEn: What are the fundamental components of a multiscale eco-hydrological observation system in arid regions?
Feature Specification.QuestionCn: 干旱地区多尺度生态水文观测系统的基本组成部分是什么？
Feature Specification.AnswerEn: flux observation matrices, eddy covariance towers, large aperture scintillometers, automatic meteorological stations, eco-hydrological sensor networks for soil moisture and leaf area index, hyper-resolution airborne remote sensing with LiDAR, imaging spectrometers, multi-angle thermal imagers, L-band microwave radiometers, ground measurements of vegetation dynamics and photosynthesis processes
Feature Specification.AnswerCn: 通量观测矩阵、涡度相关塔、大孔径闪烁仪、自动气象站、用于土壤湿度和叶面积指数的生态水文传感器网络、具有LiDAR的高分辨率机载遥感、成像光谱仪、多角度热成像仪、L波段微波辐射计、植被动态和光合作用过程的地面测量。

Quantification.QuestionCn: 2015年张掖湿地站气象数据集预计有多少条每日数据记录？

Comparison.QuestionEn: How do the data collection methods for multiscale eco-hydrological processes in oasis-desert areas compare to those used for measuring evaporation and transpiration using the TSEB model?
Comparison.QuestionCn: 在绿洲-沙漠地区，多尺度生态水文过程的数据收集方法与使用TSEB模型测量蒸发和蒸腾的方法相比，有何不同？
Comparison.AnswerEn: Data collection for multiscale eco-hydrological processes involves hierarchical nested scales with instruments like eddy covariance towers and automatic meteorological stations, capturing a wide range of environmental variables. In contrast, the TSEB model primarily relies on ground-measured soil and canopy component temperatures, supplemented by thermal infrared images to estimate evaporation and transpiration.
Comparison.AnswerCn: 多尺度生态水文过程的数据收集涉及层次嵌套的尺度，使用如涡度协方差塔和自动气象站等仪器，捕捉广泛的环境变量。相比之下，TSEB模型主要依赖地面测量的土壤和冠层组分温度，辅以热红外图像来估算蒸发和蒸腾。

Comparison.QuestionEn: What are the differences in challenges faced when collecting data in arid regions for oasis-desert systems compared to estimating surface fluxes in irrigated agricultural areas?
Comparison.QuestionCn: 在收集干旱地区绿洲-沙漠系统的数据时，与在灌溉农业区估算表面通量时面临的挑战有什么不同？
Comparison.AnswerEn: In arid regions, challenges include ecological degradation and maintaining balance between oasis and desert systems, while in irrigated agricultural areas, difficulties arise from incomplete energy balance closure and uncertainties in surface-air temperature difference affecting flux estimations.
Comparison.AnswerCn: 在干旱地区，面临的挑战包括生态退化以及维持绿洲与沙漠系统之间的平衡，而在灌溉农业区，困难则来自于能量平衡闭合的不完整以及表面与空气温度差异的不确定性，这影响了通量估算。

Interpretation.QuestionEn: How can the challenges of accurately measuring evapotranspiration in strongly advective regions influence data collection strategies?
Interpretation.QuestionCn: 在强对流区域准确测量蒸散发的挑战如何影响数据收集策略？
Interpretation.AnswerEn: Challenges such as the uncertainty in surface-air temperature differences and errors in temperature component separation might lead to strategies that incorporate high-resolution thermal imaging and stable isotope techniques to improve the validation of evapotranspiration estimates.
Interpretation.AnswerCn: 诸如地表与空气温度差异的不确定性以及温度分量分离中的误差等挑战，可能导致采用高分辨率热成像和稳定同位素技术的策略，以改善蒸散发估算的验证。

Interpretation.QuestionEn: What potential datasets could be developed to enhance the understanding of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis-desert ecosystems?
Interpretation.QuestionCn: 可以开发哪些潜在数据集，以增强对绿洲-沙漠生态系统中能量、水蒸气和碳交换的理解？
Interpretation.AnswerEn: Potential datasets could include long-term observations of energy, water vapor, and carbon fluxes, complemented by auxiliary data on hydrometeorology, vegetation, and soil parameters. This would involve comprehensive data collection from multiple land surface flux and meteorological stations across different oasis-desert systems.
Interpretation.AnswerCn: 潜在的数据集可以包括对能量、水汽和碳通量的长期观测，辅以关于水文气象、植被和土壤参数的辅助数据。这将涉及从不同绿洲-沙漠系统的多个地表通量和气象站进行全面的数据收集。

Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: What factors contribute to the challenges in accurately estimating surface fluxes in strongly advective irrigated agricultural areas?
Causal Antecedent.QuestionCn: 在强对流灌溉农业区域，准确估计表面通量的挑战因素有哪些？
Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: Accurately estimating surface fluxes in strongly advective irrigated agricultural areas is particularly challenging due to the incomplete energy balance closure with respect to the available energy and the uncertainty in surface–air temperature difference. This is often caused by errors in determining surface soil and vegetation component temperatures from the composite radiometric temperature. Additionally, the strong advective environment in such regions further complicates the estimation process.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 在强烈的平流灌溉农业区域，准确估计表面通量尤其具有挑战性，因为可用能量与能量平衡的闭合不完全，以及表面与空气温度差的不确定性。这通常是由于从复合辐射温度中确定表层土壤和植被组分温度时出现的误差。此外，这些地区强烈的平流环境进一步复杂化了估计过程。

Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: Why is there a poor availability of multiscale observations in eco-hydrological processes, and what implications does this have?
Causal Antecedent.QuestionCn: 为什么生态水文过程中的多尺度观测可用性较差，这有什么影响？
Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: The poor availability of multiscale observations in eco-hydrological processes is primarily due to the complexity and heterogeneity of such environments, which require hierarchically nested scales of instrumentation to capture the necessary data. This limitation hinders progress in the field, as comprehensive, multiscale, and multidisciplinary data are essential for understanding and modeling these processes accurately.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 生态水文过程的多尺度观测可用性差，主要是由于这些环境的复杂性和异质性，这需要分层嵌套的仪器尺度来捕捉必要的数据。这一限制阻碍了该领域的进展，因为全面的、多尺度的和多学科的数据对于准确理解和建模这些过程至关重要。

Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: What causes the crisis of ecological environment degradation in inland river basins in arid and semiarid areas?
Causal Antecedent.QuestionCn: 导致干旱和半干旱地区内陆河流流域生态环境退化危机的原因是什么？
Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: The crisis of ecological environment degradation in inland river basins in arid and semiarid areas arises from several factors, including the drying up of rivers and lakes, degradation of natural vegetation, intensification of land desertification, and frequent occurrence of dust storms. These issues are particularly prevalent in many inland river basins westward along the Silk Road, such as the Tarim River basin, Aral Sea basin, and Lake Urmia basin.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 内陆河流域生态环境恶化的危机源于多个因素，包括河流和湖泊干涸、自然植被退化、土地沙漠化加剧以及频繁发生的沙尘暴。这些问题在丝绸之路沿线的许多内陆河流域尤为严重，例如塔里木河流域、咸海流域和乌尔米湖流域。

Causal Consequence.QuestionEn: What are the consequences of employing a multiscale observation approach on the understanding of eco-hydrological processes in heterogeneous surfaces?
Causal Consequence.QuestionCn: 采用多尺度观测方法对异质表面生态水文过程的理解有什么影响？
Causal Consequence.AnswerEn: The HiWATER experiment, which employs a multiscale observation approach, aims to capture multi-scale eco-hydrological processes by arranging instruments in hierarchically nested scales. This approach can provide comprehensive data to address the challenge of poor availability of multiscale observations and enhance understanding of oasis-desert interactions.
Causal Consequence.AnswerCn: HiWATER实验采用多尺度观测方法，旨在通过分层嵌套的尺度安排仪器来捕捉多尺度生态水文过程。这种方法可以提供全面的数据，以应对多尺度观测稀缺的挑战，并增强对绿洲-沙漠相互作用的理解。

Causal Consequence.QuestionEn: How does the inclusion of both ground-based and remote sensing data affect the accuracy of evapotranspiration estimation models in arid regions?
Causal Consequence.QuestionCn: 地面观测数据和遥感数据的结合如何影响干旱地区蒸散发估算模型的准确性？
Causal Consequence.AnswerEn: Inclusion of both ground-based and remote sensing data, such as thermal infrared images and eddy covariance measurements, improves the accuracy of evapotranspiration estimation models like the TSEB model. This integration allows for reliable estimates of evaporation and transpiration even under challenging conditions like strong advection in irrigated agricultural areas.
Causal Consequence.AnswerCn: 包括地面观测和遥感数据，如热红外图像和涡度协方差测量，可以提高蒸散发估算模型（如TSEB模型）的准确性。这种集成使得即使在强平流等挑战性条件下，也能可靠地估算灌溉农业区域的蒸发和蒸腾。

Causal Consequence.QuestionEn: What are the potential implications of long-term energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange observations on sustainable development in oasis-desert ecosystems?
Causal Consequence.QuestionCn: 长期能源、水汽和碳交换观测对绿洲-沙漠生态系统可持续发展的潜在影响是什么？
Causal Consequence.AnswerEn: Long-term observations of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange provide crucial insights into the interactions between oasis and desert systems. These observations are vital for understanding the ecological stability and supporting sustainable development goals, such as carbon neutrality and ecological security, in oasis-desert ecosystems.
Causal Consequence.AnswerCn: 长期观察能量、水汽和碳交换为理解绿洲与沙漠系统之间的相互作用提供了重要的见解。这些观察对于理解生态稳定性以及支持可持续发展目标，如碳中和和生态安全，在绿洲-沙漠生态系统中至关重要。

Goal Orientation.QuestionEn: Why is it important to develop a dataset that captures soil, vegetation, and atmospheric interactions in oasis-desert ecosystems?
Goal Orientation.QuestionCn: 开发一个捕捉绿洲-沙漠生态系统中土壤、植被和大气相互作用的数据集是重要的原因是什么？
Goal Orientation.AnswerEn: Developing a dataset capturing these interactions is crucial for understanding the basic characteristics of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert ecosystems. This understanding is important for achieving sustainable oasis development, carbon peaking, carbon neutrality, and supporting ecological security and socioeconomic development in the oasis–desert area.
Goal Orientation.AnswerCn: 开发一个捕捉这些相互作用的数据集对于理解绿洲-沙漠生态系统中能量、水蒸气和碳交换的基本特征至关重要。这种理解对于实现可持续的绿洲发展、碳达峰、碳中和，以及支持绿洲-沙漠地区的生态安全和社会经济发展具有重要意义。

Goal Orientation.QuestionEn: What objectives might drive the collection of multiscale eco-hydrological data in a heterogeneous landscape?
Goal Orientation.QuestionCn: 在异质景观中收集多尺度生态水文数据的目标可能是什么？
Goal Orientation.AnswerEn: Collecting multiscale eco-hydrological data aims to address the challenge of upscaling processes on heterogeneous surfaces. The objective is to gather comprehensive data through instrumentation on hierarchically nested scales, which can help in understanding the oasis-desert interactions and support long-term ecological stability and development.
Goal Orientation.AnswerCn: 收集多尺度生态水文数据旨在解决异质表面上过程上升尺度的挑战。其目标是通过在层次嵌套尺度上进行仪器化收集全面数据，这有助于理解绿洲-沙漠之间的相互作用，并支持长期的生态稳定性和发展。

Goal Orientation.QuestionEn: What goals could motivate the integration of ground-based and remote sensing data in hydrometeorological research?
Goal Orientation.QuestionCn: 在水文气象研究中，整合地面观测数据和遥感数据的动机目标有哪些？
Goal Orientation.AnswerEn: The integration of ground-based and remote sensing data is motivated by the need to improve the estimation and validation of evapotranspiration and other surface fluxes. This approach allows for more accurate separations of soil and vegetation component temperatures, leading to better understanding and management of water resources, especially in strongly advective and heterogeneous landscapes.
Goal Orientation.AnswerCn: 地面观测数据与遥感数据的集成是为了提高蒸散发和其他表面通量的估算和验证。这种方法能够更准确地分离土壤和植被成分的温度，从而更好地理解和管理水资源，特别是在强烈的平流和异质的景观中。

Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionEn: What methodologies are used to ensure the accuracy and quality control of multiscale eco-hydrological datasets in heterogeneous landscapes?
Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionCn: 确保异质景观中多尺度生态水文数据集的准确性和质量控制的方法论有哪些？
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerEn: Instruments were arranged in hierarchically nested scales to capture multi-scale eco-hydrological processes. Observational data were carefully quality controlled throughout sensor calibration, data collection, data processing, and dataset generation, including the use of an observational system consisting of eddy covariance towers, large aperture scintillometers, and automatic meteorological stations.
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerCn: 仪器按照层次嵌套的尺度进行排列，以捕捉多尺度生态水文过程。观察数据在传感器校准、数据收集、数据处理和数据集生成的整个过程中进行了仔细的质量控制，包括使用由涡度协方差塔、大孔径闪烁仪和自动气象站组成的观测系统。

Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionEn: How are thermal infrared cameras utilized in estimating evapotranspiration in strongly advective environments with heterogeneous landscapes?
Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionCn: 热红外相机如何在具有异质景观的强对流环境中用于估算蒸散量？
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerEn: Thermal infrared cameras were used to measure soil and canopy component temperatures, which were then applied in the two-source energy balance (TSEB) model to estimate evaporation, transpiration, and evapotranspiration. The cameras provided high-resolution thermal images that were used to calculate component temperatures, which were crucial for separating soil and vegetation latent heat fluxes.
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerCn: 热红外相机用于测量土壤和冠层组分的温度，然后应用于双源能量平衡（TSEB）模型，以估算蒸发、蒸腾和蒸散。相机提供的高分辨率热图像用于计算组分温度，这对于分离土壤和植被的潜热通量至关重要。

Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionEn: What are the procedures for collecting and processing data in oasis–desert systems to study energy, water vapor, and carbon fluxes?
Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionCn: 在绿洲-沙漠系统中收集和处理数据以研究能量、水汽和碳通量的程序是什么？
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerEn: Data collection involved using eddy covariance systems and scintillometers for turbulent flux data, along with automatic weather stations for hydrometeorological data. The data processing and quality control procedure consisted of steps for data collection, processing, and archiving, ensuring the datasets included comprehensive measurements of energy, water vapor, carbon, and methane fluxes, as well as auxiliary data on hydrometeorology, vegetation, and soil parameters.
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerCn: 数据收集涉及使用涡度协方差系统和闪烁仪获取湍流通量数据，以及使用自动气象站获取水文气象数据。数据处理和质量控制程序包括数据收集、处理和归档的步骤，确保数据集包含能量、水蒸气、碳和甲烷通量的全面测量，以及关于水文气象、植被和土壤参数的辅助数据。

Enablement.QuestionEn: What technological advancements have enabled the accurate partitioning of evapotranspiration into soil evaporation and plant transpiration in heterogeneous landscapes?
Enablement.QuestionCn: 哪些技术进步使得在异质景观中能够准确地将蒸散发分为土壤蒸发和植物蒸腾？
Enablement.AnswerEn: The use of the two-source energy balance (TSEB) model, combined with ground-measured soil and canopy component temperatures and high-resolution thermal cameras, has enabled better estimation and validation of evaporation and transpiration. This approach allows for accurate separation of evapotranspiration in heterogeneous landscapes.
Enablement.AnswerCn: 两源能量平衡（TSEB）模型的使用，结合地面测量的土壤和冠层组分温度以及高分辨率热成像相机，使得蒸发和蒸腾的估算和验证得到了更好的实现。这种方法能够在异质景观中准确分离蒸散发。

Enablement.QuestionEn: How have advancements in remote sensing techniques facilitated the collection of multiscale eco-hydrological data in oasis-desert systems?
Enablement.QuestionCn: 遥感技术的进步如何促进了在绿洲-沙漠系统中多尺度生态水文数据的收集？
Enablement.AnswerEn: Advancements such as the use of LiDAR, imaging spectrometers, multi-angle thermal imagers, and L-band microwave radiometers have facilitated the collection of multiscale eco-hydrological data. These technologies enable comprehensive observations of multiscale processes within oasis-desert systems.
Enablement.AnswerCn: 诸如LiDAR、成像光谱仪、多角度热成像仪和L波段微波辐射计等技术的进步，促进了多尺度生态水文数据的收集。这些技术使得对绿洲-沙漠系统内多尺度过程的全面观察成为可能。

Expectation.QuestionEn: Why might there be challenges in collecting multiscale observations for eco-hydrological processes in arid regions?
Expectation.QuestionCn: 在干旱地区收集生态水文过程的多尺度观测可能面临哪些挑战？
Expectation.AnswerEn: Progress in the field of eco-hydrological processes is hindered by the poor availability of multiscale observations. This is due to the complexity of capturing data across heterogeneous surfaces and the need for hierarchically nested instrumentation to obtain comprehensive multiscale and multidisciplinary data.
Expectation.AnswerCn: 生态水文过程领域的进展受到多尺度观测数据稀缺的制约。这是由于在异质表面上捕获数据的复杂性，以及需要分层嵌套的仪器来获取全面的多尺度和多学科数据。

Expectation.QuestionEn: Why are errors in surface component temperature estimation particularly significant in arid agricultural areas when using remote sensing models?
Expectation.QuestionCn: 在使用遥感模型时，表面温度估计中的错误在干旱农业地区特别重要，原因是什么？
Expectation.AnswerEn: Errors in surface component temperature estimation in arid agricultural areas are significant due to factors such as the uncertainty in deriving component temperatures from composite radiometric temperatures, the impact of a strongly advective environment, and the challenges arising from image classification errors which can misclassify soil and vegetation pixels.
Expectation.AnswerCn: 在干旱农业地区，表面组分温度估计中的误差显著，原因包括从复合辐射温度推导组分温度的不确定性、强烈的平流环境的影响，以及图像分类错误带来的挑战，这些错误可能会错误分类土壤和植被像素。

Expectation.QuestionEn: What are potential reasons for the high uncertainty in estimating latent heat fluxes using the TSEB model in irrigated farmlands?
Expectation.QuestionCn: 使用TSEB模型在灌溉农田中估算潜热通量时，高不确定性的潜在原因是什么？
Expectation.AnswerEn: The high uncertainty in estimating latent heat fluxes using the TSEB model in irrigated farmlands is attributed to the uncertainty in surface–air temperature differences, errors in determining soil and vegetation component temperatures, and the strong advective conditions that affect the energy balance closure in EC flux measurements.
Expectation.AnswerCn: 使用TSEB模型在灌溉农田中估算潜热通量的不确定性较高，主要归因于表面与空气温度差的测定不确定性、土壤和植被组分温度的确定误差，以及强烈的平流条件对涡度相关法（EC）通量测量能量平衡闭合的影响。

Judgmental.QuestionEn: What is your evaluation of the effectiveness of using various meteorological instruments, such as automatic weather stations and eddy covariance systems, in capturing multiscale eco-hydrological processes in oasis-desert regions?
Judgmental.QuestionCn: 您如何评价使用各种气象仪器（如自动气象站和涡度协方差系统）在捕捉绿洲-沙漠地区的多尺度生态水文过程中的有效性？
Judgmental.AnswerEn: The use of automatic weather stations and eddy covariance systems is highly effective in capturing multiscale eco-hydrological processes in oasis-desert regions. These instruments allow for detailed measurements of energy, water vapor, and carbon fluxes, as well as other auxiliary data such as hydrometeorology, vegetation, and soil parameters. Such data are critical for understanding the complex interactions in these ecosystems and are indispensable for achieving sustainable development goals.
Judgmental.AnswerCn: 自动气象站和涡度协方差系统在捕捉绿洲-沙漠地区的多尺度生态水文过程方面非常有效。这些仪器能够详细测量能量、水蒸气和碳通量，以及其他辅助数据，如水文气象、植被和土壤参数。这些数据对于理解这些生态系统中的复杂相互作用至关重要，并且对实现可持续发展目标不可或缺。

Judgmental.QuestionEn: What is your opinion on the potential of using high-resolution thermal imagery to improve evapotranspiration estimates in strongly advective irrigated agricultural areas?
Judgmental.QuestionCn: 我对在强烈的风致灌溉农业区域使用高分辨率热成像来改善蒸散发估算的潜力的看法是什么？
Judgmental.AnswerEn: High-resolution thermal imagery holds significant potential for improving evapotranspiration estimates in strongly advective irrigated agricultural areas. By accurately capturing soil and canopy component temperatures, thermal imagery can enhance the precision of models like the TSEB model, allowing for more accurate separation of soil and vegetation latent fluxes. This approach can lead to more reliable estimates of evaporation and transpiration, especially when validated with stable isotope techniques and ground-based measurements.
Judgmental.AnswerCn: 高分辨率热成像在强烈气流灌溉农业区域中具有显著的潜力，可以改善蒸散发估算。通过准确捕捉土壤和冠层组件的温度，热成像可以提高像TSEB模型这样的模型的精度，从而更准确地分离土壤和植被的潜热通量。这种方法可以导致更可靠的蒸发和蒸腾估算，特别是在与稳定同位素技术和地面测量进行验证时。

Assertion.QuestionEn: I can’t make sense of the challenges faced in obtaining multiscale observations for eco-hydrological processes in heterogeneous landscapes.
Assertion.QuestionCn: 我无法理解在异质景观中获取生态水文过程的多尺度观测所面临的挑战。
Assertion.AnswerEn: The challenges in obtaining multiscale observations for eco-hydrological processes in heterogeneous landscapes include the poor availability of multiscale observations and the complexity involved in designing experiments that can adequately capture these processes. HiWATER addresses this challenge by using instrumentation on hierarchically nested scales to obtain multiscale and multidisciplinary data, which involves intensive observation periods and continuous hydrometeorological observations across diverse landscape types.
Assertion.AnswerCn: 在异质景观中获取生态水文过程的多尺度观测面临的挑战包括多尺度观测的可用性差以及设计能够充分捕捉这些过程的实验的复杂性。HiWATER通过在层次嵌套的尺度上使用仪器来解决这一挑战，以获取多尺度和多学科的数据，这涉及到在不同景观类型上进行密集的观测周期和持续的水文气象观测。

Request/Directive.QuestionEn: Please outline the data collection methods used to capture hydrometeorological observations in oasis-desert ecosystems, and discuss the challenges faced during these processes.
Request/Directive.QuestionCn: 请概述用于捕捉绿洲-沙漠生态系统中水文气象观测的数据收集方法，并讨论在这些过程中面临的挑战。
Request/Directive.AnswerEn: Hydrometeorological data were collected using automatic weather stations with a 10-minute average period. The data included radiation, soil heat flux, soil temperature profiles, air temperature and humidity gradients, wind speed and direction, air pressure, precipitation, and soil moisture profiles. Challenges in data collection include the poor availability of multiscale observations and the need for long-term data to understand energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in these regions.
Request/Directive.AnswerCn: 水文气象数据通过自动气象站以10分钟的平均周期收集。数据包括辐射、土壤热通量、土壤温度剖面、空气温度和湿度梯度、风速和风向、气压、降水量以及土壤湿度剖面。数据收集中的挑战包括多尺度观测的可用性差以及需要长期数据以理解这些地区的能量、水汽和碳交换。

Request/Directive.QuestionEn: Please describe the methodological approaches employed in partitioning evapotranspiration into evaporation and transpiration over heterogeneous land surfaces.
Request/Directive.QuestionCn: 请描述在异质土地表面将蒸散发分为蒸发和蒸腾所采用的方法论方法。
Request/Directive.AnswerEn: The partitioning of evapotranspiration into evaporation and transpiration was conducted using the Two-Source Energy Balance (TSEB) model, which utilized ground-measured soil and canopy component temperatures. The TSEB model was validated with eddy covariance measurements and stable isotope techniques. Component temperatures were derived from thermal infrared images, and the soil and canopy sensible heat fluxes were estimated using the series TSEB model while solving energy balance equations.
Request/Directive.AnswerCn: 蒸散发的分 partitioning 为蒸发和蒸腾是通过使用双源能量平衡（TSEB）模型进行的，该模型利用了地面测量的土壤和冠层组分温度。TSEB模型通过涡度协方差测量和稳定同位素技术进行了验证。组分温度是从热红外图像中获得的，土壤和冠层的显热通量是通过系列TSEB模型估算的，同时求解能量平衡方程。
